gurmukhi: ਭਰੰਤ ਪੱਤ੍ਰੰ || ਤੁਟੰਤ ਅੱਤ੍ਰੰ || ਝੜੰਤ ਅਗਨੰ || ਜਲੰਤ ਜਗਨੰ ||੪੬੨||
transliteration: Bharant Pattran|| Toutant Attran|| Jh Adant Agadan|| Jalant Jagadan||462||
translation: The bowls are being filled with blood, the arms are breaking, the sparks of fire are looking like glow-worms.462.

gurmukhi: ਤੁਟੰਤ ਖੋਲੰ || ਜੁਟੰਤ ਟੋਲੰ || ਖਿਮੰਤ ਖੱਗੰ || ੳੁਠੰਤ ਅੱਗੰ ||੪੬੩||
transliteration: Toutant Dholan|| Joutant Tolan|| Khimant Khadganng|| Outhant Aggadg||463||
translation: The warriors are fighting, the armours are breaking, the spears are falling on the shields and the sparks are rising.463.

gurmukhi: ਚਲੰਤ ਬਾਣੰ || ਰੁਕੰ ਦਿਸਾਣੰ || ਪਪਾਤ ਸਸਤ੍ਰੰ || ਅਘਾਤ ਅਸਤ੍ਰੰ ||੪੬੪||
transliteration: Chalant Baanan|| Roukan Disaanan|| Papaat Sastran|| Aghaat Astran||464||
translation: With the discharge of arrows, the directions have turned, there are blows and the sparks are rising.464.

gurmukhi: ਖਹੰਤ ਖੱਤ੍ਰੀ || ਭਿਰੰਤ ਅੱਤ੍ਰੀ || ਬੁਠੰਤ ਬਾਣੰ || ਖਿਵੈ ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾਣੰ ||੪੬੫||
transliteration: Khahant Khattree|| Bhirant Attree|| Bouthant Baanan|| Kheevai Keipaanan||465||
translation: The Kshatriyas, getting hold of arms in their hands, are fighting, they are discharging arrows and striking with swords.465.

gurmukhi: ਲੁੱਥ ਜੁੱਥ ਬਿੱਥੁਰ ਰਹੀ ਰਾਵਣ ਰਾਮ ਬਿਰੁੱਧ || ਹਤਯੋ ਮਹੋਦਰ ਦੇਖ ਕਰ ਹਰਿ ਅਰਿ ਫਿਰਯੋ ਸੁ ਕ੍ਰੁੱਧ ||੪੬੬||
transliteration: Loutth Joutth Bithur Rahiraavan Raam Biruddh|| Hatyo Mahodar Dekh Kar Haran(i) Ar(i) Phiryo Su Kruddh||466||
translation: In this war between Ram and Ravana the clusters of corpses scattered here and there and seeing Mahodar being killed Inderjit (Meghand) marched forward.466.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਤਿ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਬਚਿਤ੍ਰ ਨਾਟਕੇ ਰਾਮਵਤਾਰ ਮਹੋਦਰ ਮੰਤ੍ਰੀ ਬਧਹਿ ਧਿਅਾੲਿ ਸਮਾਪਤਮ ਸਤੁ ||
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatke Raamavtaar Mahodar Mantribadhah(i) Dhiaae Samaaptam Sat(u)||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled ‘The Killing of Mahodar Mantri’ in Ramavtar in BACHITTAR NATAK.
Now begins the description of war with Inderjit :

gurmukhi: ਜੁੱਟੇ ਵੀਰ ਜੁੱਝਾਰੇ ਧੱਗਾਂ ਵੱਜੀਅਾਂ || ਬੱਜੇ ਨਾਦ ਕਰਾਰੇ ਦਲਾਂ ਮੁਸਾਹਦਾ ||
transliteration: Joutte Veer Jujjhdare Dhaggadn Vajjeeaan|| Bajje Naad Kardare Dalaan Mousaahdaa||
translation: The trumpets sounded and the warriors faced one another and both the armies, prepared for war while thundering;

gurmukhi: ਲੁੱਝੇ ਕਾਰਣਯਾਰੇ ਸੰਘਰ ਸੂਰਮੇ || ਵੁੱਠੇ ਜਾਣੁ ਡਰਾਰੇ ਘਣੀਅਰ ਕੈਬਰੀ ||੪੬੭||
transliteration: Lujjhe Kaarnydare Sanhar Soorme|| Voutthe Jaan(u) Dardare Ghaneear Kaidaree||467||
translation: They who performed very difficult tasks, fought with one another and the arrows were discharged like the frightful flying serpents.467.

gurmukhi: ਵੱਜੇ ਸੰਗਲੀਅਾਲੇ ਹਾਠਾਂ ਜੁੱਟੀਅਾਂ || ਖੇਤ ਬਹੇ ਮੁੱਛਾਲੇ ਕਹਰ ਤਤਾਰਚੇ ||
transliteration: Vajje Sanleeaale Haathaan Joutteeaan|| Khet Bade Mouchdhaale Kahar Tataarche||
translation: The big chained trumpets sounded and the rows of soldiers began to fight with one another, the long-whiskered and tyrannical warriors marched forward;

transliteration: Digge Veer Jujjhdare Hoongadn Phoutteeaan|| Bakke Jaan Matvaale Bhanadn Khaaekai||468||
translation: Alongwith them the powerful fighters began to sob on falling in the battlefield.The warriors being intoxicated are shouting like someone shrieking in inebriation after eating hemp. 468
